page.title: 05Outside Ashton Windmill
page.content: Ashton Windmill is situated on the highest part of the Isle of Wedmore.It is surrounded by flat moors so that there is nothing to stop the wind blowing the sails around. In the distance are the Quantock,Mendip and Polden hills.The present windmill was built between 1760 and 1774 but there has been a windmill there for at least 600 years.It was used to grind the corn and beans for the farmers who lived nearby.The stone tower is 8 metres tall.The walls are 60 cms thick.It is round so that the wind flows around it.The sails are 16 metres long.On the top is a cap shaped like a boat to 'sail' through the wind.The cap used to be thatched .The weathercock on top told the miller which way the wind was blowing.Near the entrance is a stone for the farmer to unload his corn.
